title: Learjet_55
extract: The Learjet 55 "Longhorn" is an American business jet manufactured by Learjet.
text:
{{short description|1979 executive business jet aircraft}}
{{Infobox aircraft
 |name= Learjet 55
 |image= Learjet_55_(2323440048).jpg
 |caption=Learjet 55 on final approach
 |type= [[Business jet]]
 |national_origin= United States
 |manufacturer= [[Learjet]]
 |designer=
 |first_flight= 19 April 1979
 |introduction= 1981
 |retired=
 |status= In service
 |primary_user=
 |number_built= 147
 |produced= 1979–1987
 |developed_from=
 |variants=
}}

The '''Learjet 55''' "Longhorn" is an American business jet manufactured by [[Learjet]].

==Development and design==
The Learjet 50 series was first announced at the 1977 [[Paris Air Show]] with larger cabins than existing Learjets.<ref name="orbis" /> The series was to have three variants, the Learjet 54, 55 and 56 but only the Learjet 55 was built.<ref name="orbis" /> The Learjet 55 was a low-wing cantilever monoplane with [[NASA]]-developed [[winglets]]. The aircraft has a T-tail and is powered by two [[Garrett TFE731]] turbofans mounted each side of the rear fuselage.<ref name="orbis" /> It has a retractable tricycle landing gear and an enclosed cabin for up to ten passengers and a cockpit for the two crew.<ref name="orbis" /> Construction of the Learjet 55 began in April 1978 after extensive testing and work on the wing design which came, initially, from the Learjet 25. The Learjet 55 first flew on 19 April 1979. The first production aircraft were produced starting 18 March 1981. In total, 147 Learjet 55 aircraft were delivered.

==Variants==
;Learjet 54
:Proposed 11-seat variant, not built.<ref name="simpson" />
;Learjet 55
:Production variant, 126 built.<ref name="simpson" />
;Learjet 55B
:1986 - Improved version with a glass cockpit, improved take-off performance and increased range, 8 built.<ref name="simpson" />
;Learjet 55C
:1987 - New rear underfuselage design, with [[Strake (aeronautics)#Ventral strakes|Delta Fins]] to improve lateral [[Dutch roll]] stability, and reduce takeoff and landing speeds.
;Learjet 55C/ER
:Extended-range version of the Learjet 55C.
;Learjet 55C/LR
:Long-range version of the Learjet 55C, fitted with an extra tank, carrying an extra {{convert|259|lb|kg|abbr=on}} of fuel in the tail cone.
;Learjet 56
:Proposed eight-seat version, not built.<ref name="simpson" />

==Operators==
;{{DOM}}
* [[Servicios Aéreos Profesionales]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sapair.com/aircrafts.html |title=SAP Group - {{sic|Aircrafts|nolink=yes}} |access-date=2014-09-29 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141022174141/http://www.sapair.com/aircrafts.html |archive-date=2014-10-22 }}</ref>

==Accidents and incidents==
* On 31 January 2025, [[Med Jets Flight 056]], a Mexican-registered Learjet 55 operating as a [[Air medical services|air ambulance]] by a Miami/Mexico based Jet Rescue Air Ambulance with six people on board crashed near [[Roosevelt Mall]] in [[Philadelphia]], at the intersection of Bustleton and Cottman Avenues, 40 seconds after takeoff from  the [[Northeast Philadelphia Airport]] at 6:06 p.m. EST. The pediatric patient and her mother were en route to [[Tijuana International Airport]] in Mexico via [[Springfield-Branson National Airport]], northwest of [[Springfield, Missouri|Springfield]] in [[Greene County, Missouri|Greene County]], [[Missouri|Missouri,]] after a medical procedure in [[Shriners Hospitals for Children|Philadelphia Shriners Hospital]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Deliso |first=Meredith |title=Small plane crashes near Roosevelt Mall in Philadelphia in fiery explosion |url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/philadelphia-small-plane-crash-roosevelt-mall/story?id=118330351 |access-date=2025-02-01 |website=ABC News |language=en}}</ref> All occupants of the aircraft died in the crash.

title: UFC_Fight_Night:_Adesanya_vs._Imavov
normalized_title: UFC Fight Night: Adesanya vs. Imavov
extract: UFC Fight Night: Adesanya vs. Imavov was a mixed martial arts event produced by the Ultimate Fighting Championship that took place on February 1, 2025, at the anb Arena in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.
text:
{{Short description|2025 mixed martial event in Saudi Arabia}}
{{Infobox MMA event
|name= UFC Fight Night: Adesanya vs. Imavov
|image= UFC Saudi Arabia.jpg
|promotion= [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]]
|date= {{start date|2025|2|1}}
|venue= anb Arena 
|city= [[Riyadh]], Saudi Arabia
|attendance= Not announced<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/lists/ufc-fight-night-250-post-event-facts-israel-adesanya-career-uncharted-territory|title=UFC Fight Night 250 post-event facts: Israel Adesanya's career hits uncharted territory|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Mike Bohn|date=2025-02-02|access-date=2025-02-03}}</ref>
|gate=
|previousevent= [[UFC 311|UFC 311: Makhachev vs. Moicano]]
|followingevent= [[UFC 312|UFC 312: du Plessis vs Strickland 2]]
}}

'''''UFC Fight Night: Adesanya vs. Imavov''''' (also known as '''''UFC Fight Night 250''''' and '''''UFC on ESPN+ 108''''') was a mixed martial arts event produced by the [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] that took place on February 1, 2025, at the anb Arena in [[Riyadh]], Saudi Arabia.<ref name="Riyadh">{{Cite web|url=https://www.saudimoments.com/a-professional-slapfighting-competition-is-coming-to-riyadh-682883.html|title=A professional slap-fighting contest heads to Riyadh Season|publisher=saudimoments.com|author=Staff|date=2024-09-12|access-date=2024-09-18}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/lists/ufc-announces-2025-schedule-new-events-location-dates|title=UFC announces 2025 schedule including slew of new events|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Nolan King|date=2024-11-16|access-date=2024-11-17}}</ref>

==Background==
The event marked the promotion's second visit to Riyadh and first since [[UFC on ABC: Whittaker vs. Aliskerov]] in June 2024.<ref name="Riyadh"/>

A middleweight bout between former two-time [[UFC Middleweight Championship|UFC Middleweight Champion]] [[Israel Adesanya]] and [[Nassourdine Imavov]] headlined this event.<ref name="main">{{Cite web|url=https://von.gov.ng/adesanya-vs-imavov-headlines-ufc-riyadh-event/|title=Adesanya vs. Imavov headlines UFC Riyadh event|publisher=gov.ng|author=Samuel Chimezie Isaiah|date=2024-11-21|access-date=2024-11-27}}</ref>

A middleweight bout between [[Ikram Aliskerov]] and [[André Muniz]] was expected to take place at the event.<ref name="bout">{{Cite web|url=https://mma.bg/novini/mma-novini/ikram-aliskerov-sreshtu-andre-munis-prez-fevruari-v-sauditska-arabia#|title=Ikram Aliskerov vs. Andre Munis in February in Saudi Arabia|publisher=mma.bg|author=Staff|date=2024-10-25|access-date=2024-10-27}} {{in lang|bg}}</ref> The pair was originally scheduled to compete at [[UFC on ESPN: Perez vs. Taira]] in June 2024, but Muniz withdrew from the bout after he suffered a foot fracture.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Guilherme Cruz|date=2024-05-30|title=Andre Muniz injured, out of UFC Vegas 93 fight with Ikram Aliskerov|url=https://www.mmafighting.com/2024/5/30/24168085/andre-muniz-injured-ufc-vegas-93-fight-ikram-aliskerov|access-date=2024-05-30|publisher=mmafighting.com}}</ref> In turn, the bout was cancelled once again and was rescheduled for [[UFC Fight Night 257]] as Muniz and his team had visa issues.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/2025/01/ufc-saudi-arabia-fight-card-cancellation-andre-muniz-vs-ikram-aliskerov|title=UFC Fight Night 250 loses main card fight over passport issues|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Nolan King|date=2025-01-26|access-date=2025-01-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.telecomasia.net/news/mma/ufc-middleweight-aliskerov-i-have-a-fight-with-muniz-on-april-26/|title=UFC Middleweight Aliskerov: I Have a Fight with Muniz on April 26|publisher=telecomasia.net|author=Marina Magomedova|date=2025-02-02|access-date=2025-02-02}}</ref>

A lightweight bout between [[Jordan Leavitt]] and Abdul-Kareem Al-Selwady was scheduled for this event.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Damon Martin|date=2024-12-23|title=UFC Saudi Arabia full fight card revealed with Israel Adesanya vs. Nassourdine Imavov in main event|url=https://www.mmafighting.com/2024/12/23/24328161/ufc-saudi-arabia-full-fight-card-revealed-with-israel-adesanya-vs-nassourdine-imavov-in-main-event|access-date=2025-01-10|publisher=mmafighting.com}}</ref> However, Leavitt withdrew for unknown reasons and was replaced by Bolaji Oki.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2025-01-10|title=Bolaji Oki replaces Jordan Leavitt at UFC Saudi Arabia vs. Abdul-Kareem Al-Selwady|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/2025/01/ufc-news-bolaji-oki-vs-abdul-kareem-al-selwady-jordan-leavitt|access-date=2025-01-10|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author=Nolan King and Farah Hannoun}}</ref> In turn, one week prior to the event, Oki withdrew from the fight for unknown reasons, so the bout was subsequently cancelled.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://mmajunkie.usatoday.com/2025/01/ufc-saudi-arabia-fight-card-abdul-kareem-alselwady-vs-bolaji-oki|title=UFC Saudi Arabia loses another fight days prior to event|publisher=mmajunkie.usatoday.com|author
trending_reason: The UFC Fight Night: Adesanya vs. Imavov article is trending on Wikipedia following the event that took place on February 1, 2025, in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, featuring a high-profile middleweight bout headlined by former champion Israel Adesanya.

title: Nassourdine_Imavov
extract: Nassourdine Abdoulazimovitch Imavov is a French professional mixed martial artist who competes in the Middleweight division of the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). As of October 28, 2024, he is #5 in the UFC middleweight rankings.
text:
{{short description|French mixed martial artist (born 1995)}} {{family name hatnote|Abdoulazimovitch|Imavov|lang=Eastern Slavic}} {{Infobox martial artist | name = Nassourdine Imavov | image =Nassourdine Imavov.jpg | image_size = | other_names = The Sniper | birth_name = Nassourdine Abdoulazimovitch Imavov{{Cite web |title=Нассурдин Имавов |url=https://24smi.org/celebrity/204175-nassurdin-imavov.html |access-date=2023-12-21 |website=24smi.org |language=ru}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|03|01}} | birth_place = [[Khasavyurt]], [[Dagestan]], Russia | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | residence = | nationality = French | height = 6 ft 3 in | weight_lb = 185 | weight_class = [[Welterweight (MMA)|Welterweight]] (2016–2019)
[[Middleweight (MMA)|Middleweight]] (2019–present)
[[Light heavyweight (MMA)|Light heavyweight]] (2023) | reach = 75 in{{Cite web|title=Stats {{!}} UFC|url=http://ufcstats.com/fighter-details/881bf86d4cba8578|website=ufcstats.com|access-date=2021-06-29|archive-date=2021-11-27|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211127201720/http://ufcstats.com/fighter-details/881bf86d4cba8578|url-status=live}} | style = | stance = Orthodox | fighting_out_of = [[Paris]], France | team = [[MMA Factory]] (until 2023){{cite web|url=https://sport.gentside.com/mma/ufc/nassourdine-imavov-revele-enfin-pourquoi-il-a-quitte-fernand-lopez-et-le-mma-factory_art71388.html|title=Nassourdine Imavov révèle enfin pourquoi il a quitté Fernand Lopez et le MMA Factory|date=January 24, 2024|website=gentside.com|language=fr|author=Benoit Desaint}} | years_active = 2016–present | kickbox_win = | kickbox_kowin = | kickbox_loss = | kickbox_koloss = | kickbox_draw = | kickbox_nc = | mma_kowin = 7 | mma_subwin = 4 | mma_decwin = 5 | mma_koloss = | mma_subloss = 1 | mma_decloss = 3 | mma_draw = | mma_nc = 1 | sherdog = 217405 | footnotes = | updated = |trainer = [[Fernand Lopez]] (until 2023)
Nicolas Ott (2023–present) |caption = Imavov in 2022 }} '''Nassourdine Abdoulazimovitch Imavov''' ({{langx|ru|Нассурдин Абдулазимович Имавов}}; born March 1, 1995) is a French professional [[mixed martial arts|mixed martial artist]] who competes in the [[Middleweight (MMA)|Middleweight]] division of the [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] (UFC). As of October 28, 2024, he is #5 in the [[List of current UFC fighters#Rankings|UFC middleweight rankings]].{{Cite web |title=UFC Rankings, Division Rankings, P4P rankings, UFC Champions {{!}} UFC.com |url=https://www.ufc.com/rankings |access-date=2024-10-28 |website=www.ufc.com}} ==Background== Imavov was born to an ethnic [[Kumyks|Kumyk]] family in [[Khasavyurt]], [[Dagestan]], Russia.{{Cite web |title=Нассурдин Имавов боец ММА |url=https://www.sport-express.ru/tag/nassurdin-imavov-25282/ |access-date=2023-12-22 |website=sport-express.ru |language=ru}} At the age of 9, Imavov moved with his family to [[Salon-de-Provence]], France, where he started boxing. After that, he discovered MMA, and at 19, he moved to [[Paris]] with his older brother Daguir, where they joined [[Fernand Lopez]]'s [[MMA Factory]].{{Cite web|last=Admin|title=MMA : la nouvelle perle française s'appelle Nassourdine Imavov|url=https://www.leparisien.fr/sports/mma-la-nouvelle-perle-francaise-s-appelle-nassourdine-imavov-20-02-2021-8425626.php|date=2021-02-20|access-date=2021-07-22|work=Le Parisien|language=fr|archive-date=2021-02-20|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210220082416/https://www.leparisien.fr/sports/mma-la-nouvelle-perle-francaise-s-appelle-nassourdine-imavov-20-02-2021-8425626.php|url-status=live}} ==Mixed martial arts career== ===Early career=== Starting his professional career in 2016, Imavov compiled an 8–2 record. He was riding a 5 bout win streak before signing with the UFC, during which time he picked up the Thunderstrike Fight League Welterweight Championship{{Cite web|date=2020-10-02|title=UFC Fight Island 4: Who is middleweight Nassourdine Imavov?|url=https://fansided.com/2020/10/02/ufc-fight-island-4-middleweight-nassourdine-imavov/|access-date=2021-07-22|website=FanSided|language=en-US|archive-date=2021-07-22|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210722220822/https://fansided.com/2020/10/02/ufc-fight-island-4-middleweight-nassourdine-imavov/|url-status=live}} and a first-round beat down of former UFC welterweight [[Jonathan Meunier]] at ARES FC 1 on December 14, 2019.{{Cite web|last=Staff|date=2019-12-14|title=ARES Fighting Championship 1 Results|url=https://cagesidepress.com/2019/12/14/ares-1-results/|access-date=2021-07-21|website=Cagesi
trending_reason: The Nassourdine Imavov article is trending on Wikipedia due to his recent high-profile fight against Israel Adesanya at UFC Fight Night: Adesanya vs. Imavov on February 1, 2025, which significantly raised his visibility in the mixed martial arts community.

title: Israel_Adesanya
extract: Israel Mobolaji Temitayo Odunayo Oluwafemi Owolabi Adesanya is a Nigerian-New Zealand professional mixed martial artist, former kickboxer and boxer. As a mixed martial artist, he currently competes in the Middleweight division of the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC), where he is a former two-time UFC Middleweight Champion. In kickboxing, he is a former Glory Middleweight Championship title challenger. As of 23 January 2024, he is #2 in the UFC middleweight rankings.
text:
{{Short description|Nigerian and New Zealand mixed martial artist (born 1989)}} {{redirect|Stylebender|the 2023 film|Stylebender (film)}} {{Pp-semi-indef|small=yes}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2024}} {{Use New Zealand English|date=August 2020}} {{Infobox martial artist | name = Israel Adesanya | image = Israel Adesanya at UFC 230.jpg | image_size = | caption = Adesanya at UFC 230 in 2018 | birth_name = Israel Mobolaji Temitayo Odunayo Oluwafemi Owolabi Adesanya{{Cite web|title=BoxRec: Israel Adesanya|url=https://boxrec.com/en/proboxer/703721|access-date=9 April 2021|website=boxrec.com}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1989|07|22}} | birth_place = [[Lagos]], Nigeria | nickname = The Last Stylebender | residence = [[Auckland]], New Zealand | nationality = Nigerian{{Cite web |date=6 October 2019 |title=Nigeria's Adesanya beats Whittaker to become undisputed middleweight champion |url=https://guardian.ng/sport/other/nigerias-adesanya-beats-whittaker-to-become-undisputed-middleweight-champion/ |access-date=9 April 2023 |website=The Guardian Nigeria News – Nigeria and World News |language=en-US |archive-date=11 April 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230411190306/https://guardian.ng/sport/other/nigerias-adesanya-beats-whittaker-to-become-undisputed-middleweight-champion/ |url-status=dead }}
New Zealander | height = {{height|ft=6|in=4}} | height_footnote = | weight = 185 lb | weight_footnote = | weight_class = [[Middleweight (MMA)|Middleweight]] (2012–present)
[[Light Heavyweight (MMA)|Light Heavyweight]] (2021) | reach = 80 in{{Cite web|url=https://www.ufc.com/athlete/israel-adesanya|title=Israel Adesanya {{!}} UFC|website=UFC.com|date=14 September 2018|access-date=19 January 2020}} | reach_footnote = | style = [[Kickboxing]] | stance = Switch{{Cite web|title=Stats {{!}} UFC|url=http://ufcstats.com/fighter-details/1338e2c7480bdf9e|access-date=7 March 2021|website=ufcstats.com}} | fighting_out_of = [[Auckland]], New Zealand | team = [[City Kickboxing]] (2010–present){{Citation|title=How a movie changed my life – Israel Adesanya|url=https://www.athletesvoice.com.au/israel-adesanya-how-movie-changed-my-life/|website=Athletes Voice|date=11 August 2018|access-date=2 September 2019}} | trainer = [[Eugene Bareman]]: {{small|[[Head coach]]}}
Andrei Păuleț: {{small|[[Wrestling]]}} | rank = Purple belt in [[Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu]] under [[André Galvão]]{{cite news|url=https://bjjtribes.com/israel-adesenya-promoted-to-purple-belt-by-andre-galvao/|title=Israel Adesenya Promoted To Purple Belt By Andre Galvao|publisher=BJJTribes|date=8 December 2020}} | years_active = 2010–present | box_win = 5 | box_kowin = 1 | box_loss = 1 | box_koloss = | box_draw = | box_nc = | kickbox_win = 75 | kickbox_kowin = 27 | kickbox_loss = 5 | kickbox_koloss = 1 | kickbox_draw = | kickbox_nc = | mma_kowin = 16 | mma_subwin = | mma_decwin = 8 | mma_dqwin = | mma_otherwin = | mma_koloss = 2 | mma_subloss = 1 | mma_decloss = 2 | mma_dqloss = | mma_otherloss = | mma_draw = | mma_nc = | website = | boxrec = 703721 | sherdog = 56374 }} '''Israel Mobolaji Temitayo Odunayo Oluwafemi Owolabi Adesanya''' (born 22 July 1989) is a Nigerian-New Zealand professional [[mixed martial arts|mixed martial artist]], former [[Kickboxing|kickboxer]] and [[professional boxing|boxer]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nzherald.co.nz/sport/news/article.cfm?c_id=4&objectid=11996821|title=New Israel Adesanya was bullied as a child – now he's a New Zealand fight sensation|last=Reive|first=Christopher|date=20 February 2018|work=NZ Herald|access-date=4 November 2018|language=en-NZ|issn=1170-0777}} As a mixed martial artist, he currently competes in the [[Middleweight (MMA)|Middleweight]] division of the [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] (UFC), where he is a former two-time [[List of UFC champions#Middleweight Championship|UFC Middleweight Champion]]. In kickboxing, he is a former [[Glory (kickboxing)#Glory Middleweight Championship|Glory Middleweight Championship]] title challenger. As of 23 January 2024, he is #2 in the [[List of current UFC fighters#Rankings|UFC middleweight rankings]].{{Cite web |title=UFC Rankings, Division Rankings, P4P rankings, UFC Champions {{!}} UFC.com |url=https://www.ufc.com/rankings |access-date=19 November 2024 |website=www.ufc.com}} == Early life and background == Adesanya was born in [[Lagos]], Nigeria, the eldest of five children.

title: Ken_Martin_(politician)
extract: Kenneth Nathan Martin is an American politician from Minnesota serving as chairman of the Democratic National Committee (DNC). Martin is also chairman of the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor (DFL) Party and president of the Association of State Democratic Committees, and was previously a vice chair of the Democratic National Committee.
text:
{{Short description|American politician (born 1973)}}
{{for|other people named Ken Martin|Kenneth Martin (disambiguation)}}
<noinclude>{{Requested move notice|1=Ken Martin|2=Talk:Ken Martin (politician)#Requested move 1 February 2025}}
</noinclude>
{{Use mdy dates|date=February 2025}}
{{use American English|date=February 2025}}
{{Infobox officeholder
| name                = Ken Martin
| image               = 20201024 km 125 (cropped).jpg
| office              = Chair of the [[Democratic National Committee]]
| term_start          = February 1, 2025
| term_end            = 
| predecessor         = [[Jaime Harrison]]
| successor           = 
| office1             = Chair of the [[Minnesota Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party]]
| term_start1         = February 5, 2011
| term_end1           = 
| predecessor1        = Brian Melendez
| successor1          = 
| birth_name          = Kenneth Nathan Martin
| birth_date          = {{birth date and age|1973|7|17}}
| birth_place         = [[Minneapolis]], [[Minnesota]], U.S.
| death_date          = 
| death_place         = 
| party               = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]]<!-- via Minnesota Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party-->
| spouse              = Jennifer O'Rourke
| children            = 2
| education           = [[University of Kansas]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])
| caption             = Martin in 2020
}}
'''Kenneth Nathan Martin'''<ref name="fullname">{{cite web |title=Application to  Minnesota State Arts Board |url=https://commissionsandappointments.sos.state.mn.us/ApplicationAdditionalDocument/ApplicationFinal/35802 |access-date=February 2, 2025}}</ref> (born July 17, 1973) is an American politician from [[Minnesota]] serving as chairman of the [[Democratic National Committee]] (DNC). Martin is also chairman of the [[Minnesota Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party|Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor (DFL) Party]]<ref>{{Cite web |title=Ken Martin |url=https://dfl.org/staff/ken-martin/ |access-date=November 30, 2024 |website=Minnesota DFL |language=en-US}}</ref> and president of the Association of State Democratic Committees, and was previously a vice chair of the Democratic National Committee.<ref name="auto">{{Cite web|url=https://www.dfl.org/about/party-leaders/chair/|title=Chairman|website=The Minnesota DFL|language=en|access-date=July 31, 2019|archive-date=July 31, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190731033223/https://www.dfl.org/about/party-leaders/chair/|url-status=dead}}</ref>

== Early life and education ==
Martin was born in [[Minneapolis]], Minnesota, on July 17, 1973. He attended [[Eden Prairie High School]] and graduated from the [[University of Kansas]] in 1996 with a [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] in [[political science]] and history.<ref name="auto"/> Martin's deep involvement in student government and campus life led Chancellor Robert Hemenway to present him with the Donald K. Alderson Memorial Award, which recognizes a graduating senior whose campus involvement benefited fellow students and the greater good.{{cn|date=February 2025}}

== Career ==
Martin started his political work in 1990 as an intern for Minnesota U.S. Senator [[Paul Wellstone]]'s campaign and later interned in his official office.<ref name="nyt-who">{{cite news |last1=Glueck |first1=Katie |title=Who Is Ken Martin, the New Leader of the D.N.C.? |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2025/02/01/us/politics/ken-martin-dnc.html |access-date=February 1, 2025 |work=New York Times |date=February 1, 2025}}</ref> In 1992, Martin organized college campuses throughout the South for the Clinton/Gore campaign.<ref>https://www.minnpost.com/national/2025/01/dnc-chair-candidate-ken-martin-makes-pitch-to-labor-as-party-struggles-to-regain-footing-with-blue-collar-workers/</ref> After college, he worked in Kansas politics helping with the Kansas Democratic Coordinated Campaign as field director for the [[Kansas Democratic Party]].<ref name="MPRbio1124">{{cite news |last1=Moini |first1=Nina |last2=Zdechlik |first2=Mark |last3=Kuznetsov |first3=Aleesa |title=How Ken Martin hopes to shape the future of the Democratic party |url=https://www.mprnews.org/episode/2024/11/19/how-ken-martin-hopes-to-shape-the-future-of-the-democratic-party |access-date=1 February 2025 |work=Minnesota Public Radio |date=November 19, 2024}}</ref>

In 1998, Martin moved back to Minnesota and served as the political and field director for the [[Minnesota Democratic–Farmer–Labor Party|Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor (DFL) Party]]. He served as the deputy Minnesota State Director for the [[Al Gore|Gore]] campaign in 2000 and in 2002 was the campaign manager for secretary of state candidate Buck Humphrey. In 2004, Martin helped manage [[John Kerry]]'s presidential campaign in Minnesota.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://p2004.org/kerry/kerrorgmn.html|title=John Kerry-Minnesota Campaign Organization|website=p2004.org}}</ref>

From 2001 to 2005, Martin served as the policy aide for Ramsey County commissioner Susan Haigh. He served as the e
trending_reason: The Ken Martin article is trending on Wikipedia following his recent appointment as the Chair of the Democratic National Committee on February 1, 2025, marking a significant moment in his political career and the party's leadership.

Ken Martin has been elected as the new chair of the Democratic National Committee (DNC).
  • Ken Martin wins election as the next chair of the Democratic National Committee Ken Martin, the longtime leader of the state Democratic Party organization in Minnesota, will be the new DNC chair...
  • Who Is Ken Martin, the New Leader of the D.N.C.? Ken Martin, the Minnesota Democratic chairman, was elevated on Saturday to lead the Democratic National Committee...
  • Democrats pick Minnesota’s Ken Martin as new chair Ken Martin, the head of the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party, was decisively elected chair of the DNC on Saturday...
